result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank J Beles Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $200.00 fine plus costs.   Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim(s) without victim's and Probation Agent's consent. 
---------------------------------

The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.  Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
---------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------------------

timeConds.notes: The defendant is to complete a total of forty (40)  hours of community service work during EACH year of probation to total of eighty (80) hours of community service work during his period of probation with NO BUYOUT option.

COURT ORDERS ADDITIONAL NO CONTACT. NO CONTACT WITH J.J.B. (dob 8-13-2004).   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.
